body: @butonic, i added the audio and image types and left the if-else structure in there. what else should we do before merging?

@andrewsbrown i added some js to make results show the human description for the technical type string. 
i see the following issues left:
- [x] the files_texteditor app also needs a js fix like this for `text`. it currently customizes `text`.
- [ ] ~~the search result groups seem to be ordered non intuitive. here it started with files -> images -> folders. meh~~ not part of this pr
- [ ] ~~i also see maybe unwanted results when searching for:
 `trash` -> `_trashbin`, `key` -> several `.sharekey` and somtimes `.d<unixtimestamp>` files (i guess deleted files)~~ not part of this pr

cc @schiesbn for what files to ignore? maybe starting with path `_trashbin` or `_encryption`? in general are those like *virtual* path names or why do they start with `_`? can i deduce that paths starting in `_versions` should also be hidden (for now ... users will want to search old versions)?

@icewind1991 @karlitschek @deepdiver1975 this smells like another occurrence where passing around paths relative to `data` or starting with the owners home makes more sense to me. related to the disliked *shared* folder that we want to get rid of. not subject of this pr though.

> i could not find any search result customization js code for contacts.

eh, there is none. i'll test this branch.

when i enter anything in the search box i get:
```
php warning:  invalid argument supplied for foreach() in /home/tol/owncloud/core/lib/files/view.php on line 987
php stack trace:
php   1. {main}() /home/tol/owncloud/core/index.php:0
php   2. oc::handlerequest() /home/tol/owncloud/core/index.php:30
php   3. oc_router->match() /home/tol/owncloud/core/lib/base.php:604
php   4. call_user_func() /home/tol/owncloud/core/lib/router.php:127
php   5. __lambda_func() /home/tol/owncloud/core/lib/router.php:127
php   6. require_once() /home/tol/owncloud/core/lib/route.php(113) : runtime-created function:1
php   7. oc_search::search() /home/tol/owncloud/core/search/ajax/search.php:30
php   8. oc\search::search() /home/tol/owncloud/core/lib/legacy/search.php:56
php   9. oc\search\provider\file->search() /home/tol/owncloud/core/lib/search.php:42
php  10. oc\files\filesystem::search() /home/tol/owncloud/core/lib/search/provider/file.php:33
php  11. oc\files\view->search() /home/tol/owncloud/core/lib/files/filesystem.php:648
php  12. oc\files\view->searchcommon() /home/tol/owncloud/core/lib/files/view.php:944
```
rebased to current master
@tanghus i don't get the error you mention. it seems unrelated, but i rebased anyway. could you check again?

test passed.
refer to this link for build results: https://ci.owncloud.org/job/pull-request-analyser/1068/

@butonic, i just took a look at this again and everything seems good except that the search box is covered by the header. i think if we change line 17 in search/css/results.css to "top: 45px" it should be fixed. do you want to throw it into this pr?
@andrewsbrown noticed this as well. is also fixed in the search_scrollto branch. let us get this in first.
@butonic, sounds good; anything else need on this pr before we merge? and who merges it?

we need two reviews. here is mine :+1: ;)
but i'd like @tanghus :+1: on this because he had an error and i rebased since he tested.
a review by @deepdiver1975 or @icewind1991 would also be great.

i don't know if it's related, but while a tooltip on the searchbox says "indexing... xxx left" i get a lot of 
`{index} an exception occurred while executing 'delete from "oc_queuedtasks" where "app"=? and "parameters"=?':#012#012sqlstate[hy000]: general error: 1 no such table: oc_queuedtasks`

disabling full text search got rid of the above. and it takes forever to index with an sqlite db :p

i get the error someone else mentioned where search results are hidden behind the topbar, but maybe that's for another pr?

one hit:
![search_hidden](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/533222/1171864/ccc3379a-2110-11e3-94bd-643a921ac6db.png)

several hits:
![search_hidden1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/533222/1171922/f990eb90-2111-11e3-960a-5e94aad54a71.png)

otherwise it works great :+1: but i can see i have to do some testing on contacts search ;)

hmm just noticed that when searching in the files app and clicking on a result, nothing happens except that it reloads the page with a url like `http://localhost/owncloud/index.php/apps/files?dir=%2f&file=ak47.jpg`. the file doesn't open or anything. is that intended?

@tanghus well, search results are broken since a long time. https://github.com/owncloud/core/pull/4263 makes scrollto the default action, which replaces downloading. would be awesome if you could review that one as well. and yes, i know fts needs some love ...

> seem to be content with the default search result and only use the link to open contact / calender entries ... do those apps even have a search provider?
 
yep, but at least for contacts it may be suboptimal - aka broken ;)

@butonic i completely agree that the search result customization is unnecessary and should be removed. the search box we are working on is a tiny little thing in the corner--with that much screen real estate, it will work best if the results are returned simply and with one simple, default action: the scroll-to. i would make the case that within the advanced search app, or within the apps themselves, there is more space and user attention to add advanced ui and actions (and that's what the advanced search app was for in the first place). i think we can simplify the code significantly if we just remove customization here and add it again somewhere else.
@butonic, @tanghus what else do we need to do to merge this?

test passed.
refer to this link for build results: https://ci.owncloud.org/job/pull-request-analyser/1288/

now the legacy `oc_search_result` simply extends `\oc\search\result`. for backwards compatibility it should set the $type to the 4th arg of the ctor, so apps that haven't yet ported doesn't show `generic`.
@tanghus, does that work?

test passed.
refer to this link for build results: https://ci.owncloud.org/job/pull-request-analyser/1298/

> does that work?

@andrewsbrown yes, insofar that `generic` is now replaced by the correct identifier.

apparently i hadn't looked close enough at the code, and didn't see that the second info argument has been removed.

so calendar returns this `$results[]=new oc_search_result($object['summary'],$info, $link,(string)$l->t('cal.'));`
which in master gives:

![search_result_orig](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/533222/1242877/70dad918-2a54-11e3-8910-87e1a1458674.png)

but now there's only room for a name with no additional info, which currently returns (it could easily be changed to be the summary instead though):

![search_result_new](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/533222/1242883/b47b3ca8-2a54-11e3-9565-6754985be316.png)

i think it's a step back not being able to give any context to the result.

/cc @georgehrke 

btw, the dropdown looks like it has `overflow-y: scroll;` where it should be `overflow-y: auto;` but i guess that's not part of this pr.
@butonic i added an issue to the music app - "add search provider" owncloud/music#109
@butonic, what do we need to do to get this merged? i see @tanghus's issue above but that's a very easy fix and i can build a search provider for the music app for @kabum... would that do it?

@tanghus @georgehrke i think after @andrewsbrown fixes the issue mentioned by @tanghus we should merge this. @andrewsbrown am i correct that you will fix it so that summary and info are visible? if so it should be good to merge after a rebase.

@butonic, yeah, fixing that shouldn't be a problem. i'll do it this week.

@tanghus, the reason i removed the info part was to simplify--it seemed that no apps that i saw used it (except for calendar) so i took it out. let me take a look at it again and i'll send you an update.

> let me take a look at it again and i'll send you an update.

@andrewsbrown great. contacts uses it too btw.
@butonic, see https://github.com/owncloud/calendar/pull/253 for my proposed solution to @tanghus's problem.
